content: a fibre that yields good stndst are provided below this is worked at the start of a new round so that stitch definition not overly soft or fluffy i have mostly used 8 ply the seam is less obvious please note there are a number of ways to work this cleckheaton country australian wool this is a reasonably thick 8 ply so it stitch and i personally vary my method depending on the item i am making if may be compatible with some thinner 10 ply yarns you already have a method that works for you please substitute your preferred  use the recommended hook size as a guide only my gauge is reasonably method where this stitch is referenced in the pattern instructions if you prefer loose and i have a rider golden loop style check if your gauge is close to to 3 chain instead of using a standing stitch please substitute 3 chain for the stndst the gauge documented in the pattern details if it isn t adjust either your throughout gauge or hook size to meet the gauge stndst  the beanie is an average women s size to resize adjust yarn ply/ hook 1 chain 1 and then single_crochet in same st the sltst was made to finish the previous size/ gauge and then work a 3 round swatch you can approximately round estimate the finished circumference by using the following formula pattern gauge circumference/ pattern gauge 3rd round diameter * your 2 chain 1 and then single_crochet in the front loop only of the single_crochet made in step 1 two scs 3rd round diameter n e g 53 5cm/7cm * n cm - if n is 6 5 cm then will have now been made on top of one another your stitch should be approximately the same height as a double_crochet if so ignore step 3 if it is finished circumference will be approximately 50 cm considerably shorter go to step 3  when making the diamond flower motif rounds 2 and 3 for best results stitch into the chain stitches rather than over them 3 chain 1 and then single_crochet in the front loop only of the single_crochet made in step 2 your stitch should be the same height as a double_crochet  i recommend that for your first beanie you make the basic beanie pattern as this is the simplest pattern then try the more complex pattern options page | 2 pattern instructions 5 2 double_crochet in the next stitch 6 repeat steps 4 and 5 eight times 7 slip_stitch into the stndst from step 1 please note for all patterns documented below the slip_stitch that finishes each round does stitch count 40 not count as a stitch for stitch count purposes and as such this stitch should not be worked into in the subsequent round round 5 increase in every fourth stitch vintage vibes basic beanie pattern image 1 1 to commence the round stndst in the previous round stndst 2
